content.question: Which of the following definite integrals is equal to <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, the fraction 10 k over n, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the square root of, 1 plus the fraction 5 k over n, end root, close parenthesis, times the fraction 5 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 6, of, 10 times, the square root of x, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>10</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 6, of, 2 x times, the square root of x, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 5, of, 10 times, the square root of 1 plus x, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>⁡</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 5, of, 2 x times, the square root of 1 plus x, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 5, of, 2 x times, the square root of 1 plus x, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.3: Riemann Sums, Summation Notation, and Definite Integral Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
